intro: Navarretia pilosifaucis, commonly known as the silky navarretia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, clustered flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in coastal and inland regions. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers with four petals, and its leaves are hairy, giving it a distinctive appearance. Navarretia pilosifaucis is adapted to thrive in cool, moist environments and is often seen in open, sunny habitats.
